intro: Spermacoce stipularis, commonly known as the smallleaf rattlebox, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Spermacoce stipularis typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
